newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Telecom to start Internet access service.
newsitem.headline: Japan Telecom to start Internet access service.

text.p: Japan Telecom Co Ltd said on Thursday that it would launch a new computer network service, including Internet access, next year to compete with a rival service by industry giant NTT.

Japan Telecom's Open Data Network (ODN) will be launched next April and will provide individual users with Internet dial-up. Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp (NTT) plans a similar service in December.
For volume users, Japan Telecom will lay low-cost dedicated cables, which can be used for such things as computer data transmission and the construction of local call networks.
The service will be similar to NTT's, but the network will be priced more competitively, a Japan Telecom spokesman said.
Details of prices were not disclosed.

NTT has said it plans to charge individual users 2,300 yen ($20) a month to access the Internet for up to 15 hours a month, which is less than the cost of most other Internet access service providers in Japan.
Japan's Internet users often complain about the relatively high cost of surfing the Worldwide Web.
